meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he began to disinhibit and dance freely.
meanings.sent2: The therapy session helped her disinhibit and express her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The costume party was a great opportunity to disinhibit and have fun.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to disinhibit her, making her forget all worries.
meanings.sent5: The warm, inviting atmosphere of the gathering disinhibited everyone present.

meanings.definition: To free from social or moral constraints
meanings.sent1: The supportive environment helped disinhibit her from her fears.
meanings.sent2: The art class aimed to disinhibit creativity and self-expression.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show was a chance to disinhibit and laugh without worry.
meanings.sent4: The open discussion disinhibited people from holding back their opinions.
meanings.sent5: The positive feedback disinhibited her from feeling self-conscious.

meanings.definition: To encourage or allow unrestrained behavior
meanings.sent1: The energetic music seemed to disinhibit everyone on the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The team-building activities were designed to disinhibit collaboration.
meanings.sent3: The playful atmosphere disinhibited them to act silly and carefree.
meanings.sent4: The adventurous trip disinhibited them to try new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The supportive group disinhibited her to speak up and share her thoughts.
